newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX EUROYEN, JGBS TRADE LISTLESSLY, TONE FIRM.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX EUROYEN, JGBS TRADE LISTLESSLY, TONE FIRM.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures were confined to tight ranges in featureless trade on Wednesday but dealers said the market continued to show a firm bias.
The lead March Euroyen contract stood at 99.21 at 1115 GMT after hovering in a two-tick band against an IMM close at 99.22.
Dealers said the contract looked supported around 99.20 while the recent contract high of 99.25 continued to pose a barrier.
September JGBs ended at 126.51 against a previous 126.40.
A senior dealer at a European futures house said JGBs were underpinned by talk of large-lot buying of cash JGBs by a major Japanese fund.
Eurodollar futures ended a touch easier ahead of the release of U.S. retail sales and wholesale inflation data at 1230 GMT.
Economists surveyed by Reuters expected retail sales data to show a rise of 0.7 percent in July after rising 0.5 percent in June.
Both the overall and core Producer Price Index were expected to have risen by 0.1 percent in July.
December Eurodollars finished at 93.985 against their IMM close at 93.995. March were at 93.885 against 93.895.
